title: How many books have you read during this lockdown? What are those books? - Quora

response.answer_text: For this quarantine to be productive, I am on to the intention and aim of targetting 7–8 books. Even if I do read only half of them but retain its crest, master my reading potentially, I will be more satiated. These are the books that by all means I aspired to read from a long time but couldn't manage to do so. Now, since I have got ample hours, I keep drumming this long yearning of mine. Here is the bucket list: Premchand's Collection A House for Mr Biswas The Tale of Two cities The Three Musketeers Currently, I am on a beautiful journey with Mr Mohun Biswas to own his long yearned house. Good Luck!

I have been sharing my time doing household chores, watching serials, stitching some clothes and reading. So I did not get to read as much as I wanted to, nonetheless, I read following books during lockdown, and have many lined up too. Sankshipt MahabharatValmiki RamayanaYogVashishthhaDeath By SadhguruAdiyogi by SadhguruThe Ancient Science of Mantras By Om SwamiComplete book of Yoga By Swami VivekanandTibetan Book of the Dead By Evan WentzMoney - Master the Game By Tony RobbinsThe Yoga Suthras By Swami VivekanandFrankly, lockdown has been a blessing for me. I could finish up so many of my pending projects. I only wish that it had better cause than covid. Stay home, Stay healthy, Stay blessed…!!!
